did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Lancaster County (Va.) Organization Records, circa 1847-1951, undated

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lancaster County (Va.) Organization Records, circa 1847-1951, undated. Local government records collection, Lancaster County Organization Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer from Lancaster County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Lancaster County was named probably for the English county. It was formed from Northumberland and York Counties sometime between 26 March and 16 September 1651. The county court first met on 1 January 1652. The county seat is Lancaster.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Lancaster County (Va.) Organization Records, 1847-1951, undated, include Glebe Fund (1847-1851, undated), Masonic Lodge Nos. 76, 88, 105, 109 (1860-1897), Junior Order United American Mechanics (1898), Molusk Benefit Association (1909), Liberty Lodge No. 86 (1875), Wicomico Lodge no. 99 (1861), Campbell Memorial Presbyterian Church (1910), Methodist Episcopal Church South (1887, 1900, 1909), and other assorted church records.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Lancaster County records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm" found on the Library of Virginia's web site.
